Posts.Content: ondang2 wrote: hello just need your help what does it means!!!  in  march 2011 Im 32 yrs old at that time, I have a  spontaneos nipple discharge clear yellowish on my right breast and my doctor order me a mammo, US and cytology here's the result cytology: mild inflammatory pattern, negative for a typical cell Mammo: there are scattered fibroglandular densities no dominant mass or suspecious parenchymal focus in both breast. breast US done the same day showed bilateral nodules with benign features. benign calcifications right, skin line nipple and axillae show no abnormality BIRADS 2 US: nodules are noted in both breast with benign features  BIRADS 2 Right-solid nodule at the 12a position measuring 0.4x0.2x0.5cm. cyst at the 8-9A measuring 0.4x.03x0.3cm left-solid nodule at the 11A measuring 0.8x0.4x0.6cm cyst at the retroerola  that's was 2yrs ago since i migrate here in canada it took long to find a family dr. went I got my family dr. I complain again my nipple discharge on my right breast only on and off, spontaneous and in single duct so she performed a breast exam and  found a mobile nodule 1 cm on my right breast at 11oclock so she order me another mammo and refered me to a general surgeon, this is the result of my mammo   march 2013 mammo result the breast are composed of appoximately 50% fibroglandular densities. The parenchymal pattern is symmetric between both breasts. what does it mean??? no suspicious mass is identified. specifically, no focal abnormality is seen in the upper outer quadrant, as the patient cannot feel the any palpable abnormality, an ultrasound examination was not perform. There are no areas of architectural distortion or suspicious clusther of microcalcification. Impression: there are no specific mammographic signs of malignancy as the patient cannot feel or indicate any palpable abnormality, an ultrasound examination was not performed. management of a palpable abnormality should be based on clinical ground. If this palpable. I already met the general surgeon and he peformed a breast examination to me and he said that he did not see anything wrong on my breast everything is good and normal and he already read my mammo and like what he said there is nothing to concern and it was normal thats all. I ask the nipple discharge he said thats normal it was only a fluid that stock on my nipple. Im not satisfied with my check up and still worried about the result on my mammo what does it means can anyone explain it to me and one of my concern is  felt the lump now what my family dr found during breast exam how come that the general surgeon said that he did not feel anything wrong?  please.....................i need an explanation with my result i want peace on my mind its really hard to ask for second opinion here in canada unless there is a referral  or another concern.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: please somebody help me ondang2 Letlet

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2015 11:12PM - edited Mar 20, 2015 11:14PM by ondang2 Hi! I have also the same issue like yours, Im 36 yrs old, i have also a nipple dischrge for. Almost or morethan 4 yrs now, but until now i cant fint the answer, my discharge is spontaneous, unilateral and clear yellowish....when i found out, i have lot of test us, mammo and cytology which came back benign birad 2, after 2 yrs i still see the discharge and my family dr felt a lump on my right breast 11 oclock, 1 cm and movablewhere is the discharge is so another mammo, us and again same result what i have before, birad 2. And the surgeon said what he felt in my breast is all normal for him. Fast forward almost 2 yrs now again, my right breast is very sore where is the discharge is, maybe bec. Im Having my period but when i checked my bra i saw a very tiny red dot like a pen dot on my bra so i squeezed my nipple and it came out a clear discharge with a mix of blood so i was shocked, i called my family dr. And she referred me to surgeon she also get a sample for nipple smear its been a month now but still i dont have a call from her, but anyway i do have an appointment to a breast clinic next week and snother mammogram, Right now ihavent see any discharge in my breast and also i stop squeezing my nipple like my family dr told me, just to make sure that i dont have a discharge i always put a tissue onmy bra just to make sure and to see what color is it if ever, Im still hoping and praying for a benign result.
Posts.Title: Bloody discharge + lump, time ticking, no answers = worrying! iso ondang2

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2015 06:32PM - edited Mar 27, 2015 06:43PM by ondang2 Hi! i have the same case like yours,since i was 32 i have a nipple discharge tomy right breast clear sometimes like cooking oil consistency, uni duct and spontaneous its more than 4 yrs now. I have a clear mammo, cytology and US from 2011, 2013 and( 2015)yesterday i have mammo, cytology and US bec of clear bloody discharge last feb. 2015, sometimes i dont want to think about it anymore since all my results are always b9. But it bother me a lot when i saw my discarge that turn out to be clear bloody for 2 weeks its really very small amount. But im still thankful that there's nothing changes on my mammogram. I have a scattered fibroglandular density and brad2. i talked to my surgeon before my scan and he said he will do duct excision, but when i talked to radiologist still it depend bec. they dont see any problem with my result but they will try to find out what is the cause of my discharge. Hopefully its not bad. praying for all b9 result keep us updated gudluck.....

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2013 12:04AM - edited Jun 9, 2013 12:07AM by ondang2 Same here 2 yrs ago I have nipple discharge on right breast sometimes clear and golden yellow but no palpable lump mammogram,us cytology clear birad2 last march I still have discharge same breast spontaneous and uni duct went to family dr and during my physical exam felt a palpable lump 1cm mobile so she sent me to surgeon and diagnostic mammo all clear radiologist said no need for ultra sound bec. Mammo is clear nothing to worry but until now I still have a discharge especially before my cycle I'm still worried but surgeon said there's nothing to worry :(

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2013 10:44PM ondang2 wrote: Hello Sarah same here 2 yrs ago I have a nipple discharge like a cooking oil unilateral, spontaneous and with a single duct and my ob request for cytology, us and mammo and they turn all negative but on my mammo and us I have a cyst and solid nodules with benign features. So I thought that will be ok, but still when I look on my bra I always saw a stain and when I squeezed my nipple there's a clear yellow coming out my nipple I went to my dr. Today she request for mammo, i told her I really need an answer what is the cause of discharge bec. What I read in Internet that serous or clear yellow discharge is a sign of cancer I'm so scared right now,
